entry.title: BLOWING SNOW ADVISORY , Mary's Harbour
entry.summary: Persons in or near this area should be on the lookout for adverse weather conditions and take necessary safety precautions. Issued: 06:39 AM NST Saturday 24 December 2022

entry.title: Current Conditions: Cloudy, -3.8°C
entry.summary:
Observed at: Mary's Harbour 08:30 AM NST Saturday 24 December 2022
Condition: Cloudy
Temperature: -3.8°C
Pressure: 102.5 kPa
Visibility: 16.1 km
Humidity: 86 %
Wind Chill: -10
Dewpoint: -5.8°C
Wind: ESE 21 km/h gust 33 km/h
Air Quality Health Index: N/A

entry.title: Saturday: Snow and blowing snow. High minus 1.
entry.summary: Cloudy. Snow and blowing snow beginning near noon. Amount 5 to 10 cm. Wind becoming southeast 30 km/h gusting to 50 then increasing to 50 gusting to 80 near noon. High minus 1. Wind chill near minus 13. Forecast issued 06:00 AM NST Saturday 24 December 2022

entry.title: Saturday night: Snow mixed with ice pellets. Temperature rising to plus 1 this evening then falling.
entry.summary: Snow at times mixed with ice pellets ending near midnight then mainly cloudy. Snow and ice pellet amount 5 cm. Wind southeast 50 km/h gusting to 80 becoming southwest 20 gusting to 40 near midnight. Temperature rising to plus 1 this evening then falling. Wind chill minus 9 overnight. Forecast issued 06:00 AM NST Saturday 24 December 2022

entry.title: Sunday: Chance of flurries. High zero. POP 40%
entry.summary: A mix of sun and cloud. 40 percent chance of flurries in the afternoon. Wind southwest 20 km/h. High zero. Wind chill minus 9 in the morning. Forecast issued 06:00 AM NST Saturday 24 December 2022
